;西班牙大选于周日开始投票，这可能使该国成为最新一个政治右倾的欧盟成员国。

;

;西班牙社会主义工人党及其极左伙伴“我们能”在 5 月份的地方和地区选举中遭受重挫后，首相佩德罗·桑切斯宣布提前举行选举。桑切斯自 2018 年以来一直担任首相。

;

;周日投票的大多数民意调查显示，赢得 5 月投票的右翼人民党领先于社会党，但如果他们想组建政府，很可能需要极右翼 Vox 党的支持。

;

;这样的联盟将是西班牙政府自 1970 年代末经过近 40 年的统治向民主过渡以来首次回归极右势力。独裁者弗朗西斯科·佛朗哥的领导。

;

;PP-Vox 政府意味着又一个欧盟成员国坚定地向右转，瑞典、芬兰和意大利最近出现了这种趋势。德国和法国等国家担心这种转变对欧盟移民和气候政策的影响。

;

;西班牙的两个主要左翼政党都支持欧盟参与。右翼方面，人民党也支持欧盟，但 Vox 不支持。

;

;这次选举正值西班牙担任欧盟轮值主席国；桑切斯原本希望利用这六个月的任期来展示他的政府所取得的进步。桑切斯在选举中失利，可能会让人民党接任欧盟轮值主席国。

;

;桑切斯是最早投票的人之一，他在马德里的一个投票站投了票

;

;后来在评论大量外国媒体报道这次选举时说：“这意味着今天发生的事情不仅对我们而且对欧洲都非常重要，我认为这也应该让我们反思。”

;

;“我不想说我乐观与否。桑切斯补充道。

;

;社会党和一个名为苏马尔 (Sumar) 的新运动首次将 15 个小型左翼政党聚集在一起，希望能够取得令人意外的胜利。

;

;由于预计没有任何政党能够获得绝对多数，因此基本上只能在另一个左翼联盟和右翼与极右翼的伙伴关系之间进行选择。

;

;3700 万选民的投票站于格​​林威治标准时间上午 9 点 (0700) 开放，并将于晚上 8 点（格林威治标准时间 1800）关闭。预计将在午夜之前得出接近最终结果的结果。

;

;选举在盛夏举行，数百万选民可能会离开他们的常规投票地点去度假。但邮寄投票请求激增，官员们估计选举投票率达到 70%。

;

;在一个月的热浪结束后，预计周日该国许多地区的平均气温将超过 35 摄氏度（95 华氏度），并将比正常水平高出 5 至 10 摄氏度。

;

;桑切斯政府已引导西班牙度过了 Covid-19 大流行，并应对了通货膨胀驱动的经济俄罗斯入侵乌克兰使经济衰退雪上加霜。

;

;但他依靠边缘政党来维持少数派联盟的生存，其中包括来自加泰罗尼亚和巴斯克地区的分离主义势力，而且他通过的一系列自由主义法律可能会让他丢掉饭碗。

;

;右翼政党不喜欢桑切斯的一切，称他背叛并毁了西班牙。他们发誓要废除他的数十项法律，其中许多法律使数百万公民和数千家公司受益。

;一对中国名人夫妇在网上宣传“如果父母不带孩子去迪士尼乐园，会让他们感到自卑”，因此遭到大陆公众的强烈反对。

;

;据视频新闻网站报道，中国女演员黄圣依和她的演员出身的商人丈夫杨子上个月在视频平台抖音的直播中发表了这一言论，当时他们正在上海迪士尼乐园门票的付费促销活动中大象新闻。

;

;“如果你的孩子听到其他孩子炫耀自己和父母一起去迪士尼乐园的经历，而你从来没有带自己的孩子去过主题公园，他们自然会感到自卑。”杨在直播中说道。

;

;“我们经常告诉孩子不要自卑，要有积极向上的精神。但我想问你：你为你的孩子做了什么？

;

;“当你的孩子（因为错过了去迪士尼乐园）感到羞耻时，你不会感到心痛吗？不带孩子去迪士尼乐园你不会感到羞耻吗？赶紧行动起来，买票吧。”

;

;直播中，黄老师惊呼：“有人订票了。”

;

;上海迪士尼乐园是内地为数不多的国际品牌游乐园之一，但自2016年开业以来，频频因门票价格过高、园区餐饮等服务问题而被诟病。

;

;上个月，一名客人穿着安娜公主在《冰雪奇缘》中所穿的中国传统汉服版裙子被拒绝入场，除非她把衣服遮盖起来。一位发言人后来表示，问题是由迪士尼人物服装引起的，而不是服装中的汉服元素。

;

;过去几年，上海迪士尼乐园多次提高票价，目前平日票价为 475 元（66 美元），公众假期票价几乎翻倍，达到 799 元。

;

;截至发稿时，该公园尚未回复《华盛顿邮报》的置评请求。

;

;40 岁的黄是一位著名的名人。中国女演员，曾出演香港导演周星驰 2004 年的电影《功夫》。杨先生以前是一名演员，但现在更出名的是中国北方河北省的一名商人。

;

;这对夫妇作为影响者在内地社交媒体上拥有大量粉丝，两人的微博粉丝都超过3000万。

;

;这对夫妇的笨拙宣传在中国引起了震惊和愤怒，许多人指责他们傲慢无知，对普通人面临的艰难处境表现出无知。

;

;“这是什么逻辑？这根本就是情感绑架啊！我们还有太多的地方没有去过，太多的事情我们没有做过。那么我们每个人都应该为没有进入太空而感到悲伤吗？”

;

;“这种卑鄙无耻的宣传行为应该严格监管。”另一位网友表示。

;

;还有人表示同意：“杨先生，您的孩子读到这个故事后，会感到自卑和羞耻。”

;

;但一位评论者指出，如果孩子觉得自己落后于同龄人，就会产生自卑感，这是有道理的。

;

;“小孩子无法对自己进行心理调节，因此家长应该认真引导他们养成正确的心态。”该人士建议。

;

;大陆富有的明星因炫富和脱离现实而遭到公众的愤怒，这已经不是第一次了。

;

;上个月，女演员张雨绮在一次在线销售直播中表示，699元（97美元）对一个普通中国大陆工人来说是一笔巨款，甚至买不到她一双袜子，因此受到严厉批评。

;分析师和公司表示，内部碳定价是企业减少温室气体排放并推动行为改变以实现脱碳目标的有用工具。

;

;企业面临着来自投资者、监管机构和利益相关者的越来越大的压力，要求企业根据全球目标制定和实现气候目标，以遏制气候变化浪潮并防止全球气温升高造成最具破坏性的后果。

;

;对碳制定内部价格可以有所帮助提供可持续发展和碳战略咨询服务的德勤 CarbonCare Asia 执行董事 John Sayer 表示，企业和机构根据强制性法规或自己的自愿目标（例如净零目标）来衡量、规划和实现减少温室气体排放的目标。

;

;“当对碳排放定价时，碳排放的外部环境成本和中长期后果将成为整个价值链运营和资本支出决策的附加标准。”

;

;Sayer 说。根据 CDP 的说法，这种做法正在帮助企业评估与气候相关的风险和机遇。 CDP 是一家为公司、城市、国家和地区运营全球环境信息披露系统的非营利组织。

;

;CDP 网站称，“通过将气候风险赋予货币价值，并将其转化为统一的指标，公司内部的财务决策者能够将低碳转型作为其业务战略的一个组成部分”。

;

;香港政府承诺到 205 年实现碳中和。前行政长官林郑月娥在其 2020 年施政报告中表示，“我们希望实现这一目标”。

;

;德勤的 Sayer 表示，政府可能会通过涵盖可再生能源和建筑能源效率、交通和废物管理方面的法规和激励措施来推动这一计划。

;

;“内部碳定价体系是应对这种可能情况的一种良好的主动方法，为企业提供了全面了解其脱碳挑战所需的事实和数据。”

;

;Conglo太古公司今年正在试行内部碳定价模型，该模型将支持其到 2050 年实现净零排放的计划。

;

;根据其 2022 年可持续发展报告，“ICP 将碳定价纳入未来运营公司项目的决策过程中，同时促进实现我们的排放目标”。

;

;该计划于 2022 年获得批准，包括太古可口可乐、太古地产和香港飞机工程公司，它们贡献了超过 80% 的碳排放太古集团的混合模式包括向每个运营公司收取碳费，本质上是“内部碳税”，太古集团可持续发展集团主管马克·哈珀 (Mark Harper) 在 6 月底《华盛顿邮报重新定义香港》活动中表示。围绕脱碳活动。”

;

;影子定价机制还将适用于所有未来的投资以及超过一定投资门槛的重大资本支出项目。

;

;哈珀表示：“这两种工具将帮助我们现在脱碳，同时也推动我们在未来实现净零业务。”

;

;咨询毕马威中国还实施了内部碳定价体系，对与员工商务旅行相关的温室气体排放进行收费。

;

;内部碳定价“被视为毕马威中国影响力计划主管合伙人庞伟表示：“毕马威中国去年推出的内部碳定价体系，每吨碳排放的平均价格约为每吨碳排放20美元。” “我们将在未来几个月和几年内增加碳排放量，以鼓励同事减少碳排放，并筹集更多资金用于脱碳项目。”他表示。

;

;通过内部碳定价产生的资金将用于资助公司的脱碳举措，以实现其气候目标“从节能、绿色出行举措和潜在的基于自然的解决方案，到碳清除项目”。

;

;根据毕马威中国的计算，乘坐经济舱航班从上海到北京的单程旅行”根据其网站，将这种影响纳入投资等商业决策中”。 MOL集团将在2025年将二氧化碳定价为每吨约60美元，在2040年为每吨约140美元。

;

;该公司表示：“这将促进集团的低碳和脱碳业务以及提供低碳和脱碳服务的措施，旨在减少我们业务活动和整个社会的温室气体排放。”。

;

;香港中华煤气（Towngas）目前正在研究企业ESG（环境、社会及管治）主管杨艾萨克表示，计划分阶段实施内部碳定价。

;

;“实施内部碳定价可以激励我们的员工和业务部门减少碳排放，并为外部碳定价计划做好准备。”

;

;香港电力公司中电集团也将碳定价作为其业务发展的一部分，以评估可再生能源和能源服务项目的财务回报。

;

;公司考虑该集团表示，气候情景分析中的碳定价风险是为了测试其到2050年实现碳中和的过渡计划的弹性。

;

;中电集团在回应《华盛顿邮报》的询问时表示，“碳定价对于了解和监控我们当前资产的财务风险，以及应对我们运营地区现有或可能出现的温室气体排放政策和法规的潜在变化也很重要。”虽然内部碳定价是公司的有用工具，但它“不是灵丹妙药”太古集团的 Harper 表示，“这是一个至关重要的工具，但不是公司工具箱中应该拥有的唯一工具。”

;

;尽管如此，根据德勤的 Sayer 的说法，公司应该尽早​​开始对碳定价，即使他们对过程的某些方面还不确定。

;

;“[内部碳定价]让内部和外部利益相关者相信公司正在控制碳减排问题，准确而细致地评估其温室气体排放量，并建立有效的机制来推动减排并长期保护公司价值，”他说。

;据卫生专家称，美国决定切断中国病毒研究所获得美国联邦资金的机会，不会影响其运作，但确实反映了两国之间的相互不信任。

;

;美国卫生与公众服务部周一宣布，因可能违反生物安全规定，暂停向武汉病毒研究所提供资助和与其签订合同。

;

;该研究所是未经证实的实验室泄露指控的焦点。

;

;该部门表示，采取这一行动是因为该研究所未能根据自 2014 年开始的 10 年期资助条款提供实验室笔记本条目和文件等所需文件。

;

;香港大学生物医学科学教授金冬燕表示，当时这笔资助是国际上对该研究所工作的认可。

;

;“现在该项目被取消，正在传递[中国人之间]相互不信任的信息。金说。

;

;中国的繁文缛节如何阻止美国科学家获得早期病毒

;

;这笔赠款授予美国非营利性生态健康联盟并分配给该研究所，旨在探索蝙蝠冠状病毒对人类的风险。该项目于 2014 年 6 月启动，五年后续签，但在美国前总统唐纳德·特朗普的领导下被暂停。

;

;该部门表示，周三的举措是“减轻任何潜在公共卫生风险所必需的”。

;

;生态健康联盟没有回应置评请求。

;

;耶鲁大学公共卫生副教授陈曦表示，美国的决定是一个罕见的先例，但随着近年来两国关系的恶化，他对此并不感到惊讶。

;

;陈表示，取消资助的影响可能是“深远的”，美国国立卫生研究院资助的美国和中国机构之间的研究合作已经“迅速下降”。

;

;“这进一步削弱了两国政府和科学家之间在可以预防下一次大流行和其他全球卫生紧急情况的基础研究方面的信任，”他说。

;

;美国西顿霍尔大学全球健康研究中心主任黄彦忠对此表示同意。

;

;“撤回资助不太可能对[武汉研究所]的正常运作或整个中国医学研究行业产生重大影响，”他说。

;

;“但是，这一决定无疑会给未来的中美生物医学合作发出令人不寒而栗的信号。”

;

;他同意，美国政府因涉嫌违反资助生物安全协议且未能提供所需信息而暂停资助的情况很少见。

;

;他黄说，这一决定无助于降低中国实验室的生物安全风险。

;

;“暂停对实验室的资助可能会无意中激励中国在合规方面寻求更大的独立性和自给自足，从而削弱华盛顿在这一领域的影响力。”

;

;近年来，在中美关系恶化的情况下，科学合作变得更加困难。世界领先的生物医学研究资助机构美国国立卫生研究院 (NIH) 自 2018 年以来加强了对涉嫌未披露与中国外国机构联系的受资助者的调查。美国国立卫生研究院 (NIH) 开始就财务和安全问题对武汉实验室进行调查。

;

;根据斯坦福大学去年发表的一项研究，调查和美中紧张局势的加剧也让科学家“不愿意与中国的机构开展新的或继续现有的合作”。

;

;埃隆·马斯克周日表示，他正在考虑更改 Twitter 的徽标，并发推文称：“很快我们将告别 Twitter 品牌，并逐渐告别所有鸟类。”

; Sun, 23 Jul 2023 16:20:02 +0800 How late singer Coco Lee crossed cultural divides to bring together Chinese communities around the worldhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/diplomacy/article/3228432/how-late-singer-coco-lee-crossed-cultural-divides-bring-together-chinese-communities-around-world?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.23 16:00;
;;

;“我对自己的表现非常满意，希望我能让中国人民感到骄傲”，2001年奥斯卡金像奖颁奖典礼上，26岁的李玟身穿意大利时装设计师Donatella Versace设计的深红色旗袍走下舞台时对记者说。

;

;“今天我们代表中国人民，所以我想穿一些具有中国风格的衣服。”

;

;这位已故流行歌星于 7 月 5 日自杀未遂，去世，享年 48 岁。她演唱的李安奥斯卡获奖影片《卧虎藏龙》主题曲《爱在时间之前》是她 30 年职业生涯中最受瞩目的时刻之一。

;

;直到今天，她仍然是唯一一位在好莱坞最负盛名的颁奖典礼上表演的中国歌手。

;

;李安的职业生涯跨越了大洲和几代人。除了在亚洲音乐排行榜上名列前茅并成为中国千禧一代家喻户晓的名字外，她还为迪士尼的《花木兰》（1998）配音，并为该剧演唱了国语版歌曲《倒影》。她还凭借《Just No Other Way》（1999 年）在美国成名，这是中国歌手录制的第一张英文 R&B 专辑。

;

;跨学科媒体学者邹盛表示，这位明星在华人社区中拥有比她在主流社会中取得的成功更大的“特殊地位”。这是只有文化背景下的人才能理解的东西。

;

;“她代表了一种泛华人身份，这种身份超越了单一地区，跨越了世界各地不同的华语社区，”在浸会大学任教的邹说。

;

;“她作为华人侨民的一部分，超越了来自大陆、台湾和香港的简单群体。”

;

;李在香港出生和长大，后来随家人搬到了旧金山。 10 岁时，她与母亲和两个姐妹结婚。高中毕业后，她重返参加一场流行歌唱比赛并获得亚军。两年后，她搬到台湾，使她成为地区明星。在她生命的最后十年里，她主要活跃在中国大陆。

;

;但李在 20 世纪 90 年代末到 2000 年代初之间才在全球取得了成功。那段时期是东西方流行文化愉快交融的时期，女演员杨紫琼和电影制片人成龙等许多亚洲天才吸引了全世界的观众。

;

;在她去世的消息传出后，人们纷纷表达哀悼之情，这一点就显而易见。歌迷和其他名人都对她留下了美好的回忆，包括台湾歌手蔡依林、粤语流行偶像郑秀文和美籍华人演员吴彦祖。

;

;“很多人超越政治分歧，团结起来，通过守夜和其他活动来纪念她，”邹说，他指的是在李的家乡武汉（也是他的家乡）举行的歌迷组织的献花仪式。 “我们都为她感到非常自豪，”他说。

;

;邹指出，李从来都不是政治艺术家，而且很少（如果有的话）表达她对特定政治话题的看法。但是，凭借华裔美国人的混血身份和富有感染力的个性，她成为了一位文化大使。

;

;“她参加了许多由大陆政府组织、赞助或发起的文化活动。 There could have potentially been a role of cultural diplomacy that she was supporting either intentionally or unintentionally,” Zou said.

;

;A recently resurfaced clip from 2001 showed Lee, alongside cultural figures including television presenter Dou Wentao and filmmaker Stephen Chow, jumping for joy in a press room at the news that Beijing would host the 2008 Olympic Games. Lee sported a T-shirt with a design that artfully combined the Chinese flag with a Sichuan opera mask.

;

;According to Chinese-American singer-songwriter Li Ziming, who recently relocated to Shanghai after close to two decades in California, Lee's albums, which he used to find in local libraries, provided a way for him to stay in touch with Chinese pop music after leaving Hunan at the age of 10.

;

;“The soundtrack of Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon, featuring both the Chinese and English versions of 'A Love Before Time', played repeatedly on my Walkman. This experience heightened my awareness of and pride in my Chinese identity,” Li said.

;

;“Coco's embrace of her Chinese heritage has served as a significant source of encouragement for Chinese communities abroad.”

;

;Her performance at the Oscars, where she proudly showcased her culture, was also seen as a “significant milestone” for Chinese-Americans, inspiring many to overcome racial barriers in their own lives, Li said.

;

;“Coco seamlessly blended English with Chinese in her music … Her vocal technique is distinctly Western, yet the sweetness in her voice aligns with Chinese tastes, making her truly unique.”

;

;Amanda Wu, a San Francisco-based digital designer, said Lee was her gateway to foreign contemporary music during her childhood in Nanjing, where she saw Lee in concert twice.

;

;“It was through Coco that I came into contact with Western pop music as a teenager,” she said. “She evoked a Western flair through her music and style, which were particularly vibrant and fashionable during that era.”

;

;A week after Lee's death, Wu organised a remembrance gathering at Stanford University, attended by more than 100 fans, including students from the music school who performed a tribute.

;

;“I have [attended fan meet-ups] before, when I was a teenager, and because of Coco I've met like-minded people and made many good friends … And today, many years later, because of her death, I once again felt the energy of everyone being united by her. I felt quite emotional.”

;

;Wu said Lee touched more than the Chinese community, with many of her Asian friends, including one from Vietnam, also feeling the impact of her death.

;

;“I have felt it personally, interacting with people around me, that Coco represented Asians on the international stage, which I think is very powerful.”

;

;Wu said she hopes that a new generation of Chinese artists would continue Lee's legacy as a cultural icon.

;

;“Having been in the US for a long time, sometimes I question why other Asian cultures, like Korean and Japanese, are able to export their cultures so successfully,” she said. “I truly hope that there will be more people like Coco, who are able to take our music to the global stage, making more people aware of the Chinese music scene.”

;

;Additional reporting by Yvonne Sun

; Sun, 23 Jul 2023 16:20:02 +0800 India’s AI newsreaders are multilingual, cost-saving and ‘never tired’. Can they replace humans?https://www.scmp.com/week-asia/lifestyle-culture/article/3228570/indias-ai-newsreaders-are-multilingual-cost-saving-and-never-tired-can-they-replace-humans?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.23 16:00;
;;

;In April, an artificial intelligence chatbot presented the news on television for the first time in India. The chatbot named Sana had fair skin and long black hair and read the highlights on the Hindi-language news channel Aaj Tak that is owned by the India Today group, one of the biggest media houses in the country.

;

;Following Sana, Odisha TV in eastern India revealed its chatbot named Lisa that wears a sari, has dark-rimmed eyes and reads the headlines in Odia, the local language.

;

;The chatbots delivered the news in a monotonous voice and made no hand gestures.

;

;But they heralded a milestone in broadcasting TV and digital journalism, presenting news, weather forecasts and financial and sports updates all in real time without needing a break.

;

;With two chatbots established as TV presenters within three months, the speed of change driven by AI has taken even experts by surprise. While they had expected the new technology to quickly impact industries such as financial services, information technology and healthcare, few expected it to take root in the media so quickly.

;

;The uptake of AI in the media industry also contrasts sharply with the level of mobile phone penetration in India, where over half the population is without smartphones.

;

;In a country with 22 official languages, the multilingual Sana and bilingual Lisa could make it much easier for Indians to consume news.

;

;While Lisa currently speaks only in English and Odia, Sana can speak 75 languages, though she presents only in English, Hindi and Bangla for now.

;

;During Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to France earlier this month, Sana spoke about the visit in French, with Hindi subtitles.

;

;Both India Today and Odisha TV say the chatbot presenters complement human presenters and journalists, and are not substitutes for their human counterparts.

;

;Will world's first global AI regulation summit 'freeze out' firms from Asia?

;

;Often, after reading headlines, Lisa and Sana hand over to a human presenter who then facilitates a debate with panellists.

;

;“It's a question of more efficiency in the newsroom and enhancing the creativity of our staff by removing mundane and repetitive tasks. Sana can speak in multiple languages, switch between topics with ease and is never tired,” said Vivek Malhotra, head of marketing and strategy at India Today.

;

;The view was echoed at Odisha TV. “丽莎将成为一个很好的合作伙伴。 [It] does the jobs that are repetitive and data analytical, so newspeople can focus on new angles and more creative work,” said Jagi Mangat Panda, the channel's managing director.

;

;But work is under way to train the chatbots to conduct television debates. Mallhotra said Sana is undergoing training to facilitate a debate with both human and AI panellists.

;

;“As a newsroom, we have to stay at the frontier of all new technologies, and so we will be experimenting and adopting all that AI has to offer,” he said.

;

;Supporters of the AI news presenters point to the advantages of 24 hour news coverage, linguistic diversity, and the ability to process vast amounts of data – live election results or financial updates – at high speed.

;

;But others expressed concern about employment security, a lack of nuance in stories, and the sheer lack of a human element.

;

;Media experts such as Sevanti Ninan, who headed a portal that tracks and monitors media trends and press freedom, believe that on-the-ground reporting and investigative journalism remain safe from AI bots as they cannot replicate human observation and experience, for now.

;

;“AI chatbots will save costs and they can be used for headlines, but I don't see how they can replace a reporter out in the field asking questions. What they will do to the concept of star anchors is too soon to say,” she said.

; Sun, 23 Jul 2023 16:20:02 +0800 Hong Kong’s John Lee brushes off possible legal action by golf club over plan to build public housing on oldest coursehttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/hong-kong-economy/article/3228638/hong-kongs-john-lee-brushes-possible-legal-action-golf-club-over-plan-build-public-housing-oldest?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.23 16:15;
;;

;Hong Kong's leader has rejoined the fray over a plan to build public housing on part of the city's oldest golf course, insisting authorities will still take back the land despite possible legal action.

;

;Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu stood firm on the government's position on Sunday, after the Hong Kong Golf Club filed an application for a judicial review to overturn the approval of an environmental impact report that gave the go-ahead for construction at the site.

;

;Speaking ahead of his week-long trip to Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia, Lee said the club's move would not affect plans to take back the 32-hectare (79 acres) site in September.

;

;Public housing plan for golf course 'may be delayed for years if legal bid accepted'

;

;“Hong Kong is a society based on the rule of law. We respect everyone to exercise their legal rights,” he said.

;

;“But the government will continue the work to take back the 32-hectares as the resumption of land is not the focus of the judicial review, but rather the environmental impact assessment … As to the judicial review, we'll leave it to the courts.”

;

;The fight over the site, run by the club since 1911 under a government lease, has put some of the most influential public figures in the city on opposite sides of the battle lines.

;

;The club revealed on Friday it would turn to the courts to try to block the government's plan to build public flats on 9.5 hectares, with the rest of the 32 hectares reserved for conservation and recreational use.

;

;In its application for the judicial review, the club, which counts some of the city's most powerful politicians and business leaders as members, is hoping to convince the court that the impact assessment approved in May is fundamentally flawed.

;

;Authorities initially intended to build 12,000 homes on the site, but the number will be revised after the director of environmental protection called for the preservation of a patch of woodland in approving the impact assessment report.

;

;As part of a procedural requirement, the Town Planning Board is expected to meet on Monday to decide whether to temporarily designate the use of the 9.5-hectare residential site as “undetermined” but intended for flats, while the remainder will be reserved for conservation and recreation.

;

;The redevelopment plan may need to go through another round of public scrutiny and the planning board will make its recommendation by November at the latest. Lee and his top advisers will make a final decision on whether to change the land uses for the outline zoning plan.

;

;Redeveloping parts of the Fanling site as an alternative to country parks was one of several out-of-the-box housing supply proposals suggested by the Task Force on Land Supply, a brainchild of former leader Carrie Lam, to tackle the city's acute shortage of land for flats.

;

;The original target of building the flats by 2029 is expected to be pushed back to 2031 given the decision to preserve the woodland.

;

;Separately, Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po on Sunday said the government had achieved a breakthrough in speeding up the supply of land and housing following the passing of a bill in the Legislative Council earlier this year.

;

;The new law, effective from September 1, aims to speed up and simplify procedures for land use planning and development.

;

;Third Hong Kong government adviser calls for U-turn over housing plan on golf course

;

;“In the next 10 years, the supply of 'spade-ready' land will reach 3,300 hectares, over half of which comes from the two strategic growth areas of the Northern Metropolis and Kau Yi Chau artificial islands,” he said on his blog.

;

;Chan said the changes would accelerate construction at the two sites by reducing the time for producing spade-ready sites from more than 10 years in the past to seven years.

;

;“For public housing projects, the time for turning 'primitive land' into 'spade-ready' sites can be reduced to four years from six years.”

;

;He added two task forces set up to resolve housing issues had rolled out 11 measures to simplify procedures for building height restrictions, landscape requirements, site coverage, gross floor area and plot ratio.

; Sun, 23 Jul 2023 16:20:02 +0800 Hong Kong leader John Lee vows to seize business opportunities on Asean trip, lobby for support to join world’s largest free-trade pacthttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/3228635/hong-kong-leader-john-lee-vows-seize-business-opportunities-trip-asean-states-lobby-support-join?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.07.23 14:28;
;;

;Hong Kong's leader vowed on Sunday to seize business opportunities during his week-long trip to Asean countries and lobby for support to join the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP), the world's largest free-trade deal.

;

;Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu also said the 10-member Association of Southeast Asian Nations (Asean), and the wider region, would become the biggest economic engine globally.

;

;Lee made the remarks before kicking off his trip to Singapore, Malaysia and Indonesia with a delegation of five top officials and 30 leaders from finance, investment, business, legal, innovation and technology, and logistics sectors.

;

;“The reason for choosing Asean is because it enjoys great development potential,” Lee said, citing the region's 5.5 per cent economic growth last year and the average 4 per cent increase in the past decade.

;

;“With the shifts in economic power from the West to the East, Asean and the whole of Asia will become the world's largest economic engine. We have signed a free-trade agreement with Asean, so we already have very good foundations.”

;

;He noted the importance of the trip and that the delegation was in “high spirits” to embrace every opportunity to promote Hong Kong as a place for business.

;

;The chief executive also revealed the trip had a further goal of securing more support for the city to join RCEP, which is made up of 15 Asia-Pacific countries, including 10 Asean states.

;

;'People are having doubts': is Hong Kong losing edge to Singapore as legal hub?

;

;“Joining RCEP not only benefits Hong Kong but also allows us to contribute to [regions under] RCEP,” Lee said, adding the city was working on different aspects to strengthen its competitiveness, including developments in eight key areas under China's 14th Five-Year Plan.

;

;The “eight centres” outlined in the plan include international finance, innovation and technology, cultural exchange, trade, shipping, aviation, legal and dispute resolution services, and intellectual property.

;

;“I believe that after establishing a good foundation, the chances of joining RCEP are high and I will strive for support from different countries,” he said. Singapore, Indonesia and Malaysia had all expressed their backing in the past and the trip would be used to consolidate their support, according to Lee.

;

;Hong Kong's leader to start public consultation in lead-up to second policy address

;

;Chinese foreign policy chief Wang Yi voiced support earlier this month for the city's accession to the trade bloc at a meeting of Southeast Asian foreign ministers in Indonesia. He appealed to Asean members, as well as Japan and South Korea, to uphold “openness and cooperation” to accelerate regional integration.

;

;The trip marks Lee's second visit to Asean countries since taking office in July last year.

;

;Lee is expected to meet Singapore Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Monday. After visiting the city state, Lee and his delegation will travel to Jakarta on Tuesday before landing in Kuala Lumpur on Thursday.
